subject: Re: [junit] incompatible types
msgSnippet: You have the old Test.class file lying around your file system from before you changed your own Test class to MyTest. Clean up the *.class files and recompile.
messageBody:
You have the old Test.class file lying around your file system from before you changed your own Test class to MyTest. Clean up the *.class files and recompile.

Good luck.

So said Nancy on 2/28/2003 --------------------

>Hi Jason
>
>Thank you for your help.
>The following is the copy of the error msg.
>
>======================================
>
>c:\>javac AllTests.java
>AllTests.java:22: incompatible types
>found : junit.framework.TestSuite
>required: Test
> return suite;
> ^
>.\MyTest.java:29: incompatible types
>found : junit.framework.TestSuite
>required: Test
> return new TestSuite(MyTest.class);
> ^
>2 errors
>
>c:\>
>==========================================
>The following is the source:
>
>import junit.framework.*;
>public class AllTests //I removed extends TestSuite here, as
>you
>suggested
>{
> public static void main (String[] args)
> {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
> }
>
> public static Test suite ( )
> {
> TestSuite suite= new TestSuite();
> suite.addTest(new TestSuite(MyTest.class));
> return suite;
>//line22 where the error occured
> }
>}
>
>
>---------------------------------------------------
>import junit.framework.*;
>import java.util.*;
>public class MyTest extends TestCase {
> ArrayList a;
> public MyTest(String name) {
> super(name);
> }
> protected void setUp() {
> a = new ArrayList();
> }
> public void test12() {
> assertTrue(a.size() == 8);
> }
>
> public void test14() {
> assertTrue(a.size() == 90);
> }
>
> public static Test suite() {
> return new TestSuite(MyTest.class); / /line29, where the
>error occured
> }
> public static void main(String[] args) {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
> }
>}
>
>Thanks again for your help,
>
>Nancy
>
>
>
>
>
>
>----- Original Message -----
>From: "Jason Rogers" <jacaetevha@...>
>To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
>Sent: Friday, February 28, 2003 5:11 PM
>Subject: Re: [junit] incompatible types
>
>
>> Nancy,
>>
>> Could you send the actual output of javac as well as your sources?
>>
>> One thing to note, AllTests doesn't need to extend TestSuite.
>>
>> =jason
>>
>> On Fri, 2003-02-28 at 16:18, Nancy wrote: Hi Larry
>>
>> Thank you for your reply. I tried use MyTest instead of Test as class
>> name,
>> it shows me the same error. I tried my TestSuite class--as following, it
>> shows me the same error;
>>
>> ===================================================
>>
>> import junit.framework.*;
>>
>> public class AllTests extends TestSuite
>> {
>> public static void main (String[] args)
>> {
>> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
>> }
>> public static Test suite ( )
>> {
>> TestSuite suite= new TestSuite();
>> suite.addTest(new TestSuite(MyTest.class));
>> return suite; /////// shows same error here----espect
>> Test
>> but return TestSuite
>> }
>> }
>> =================================
>> The problem is strange. What could be wrong? Configuration?(I added
>> junit.jar in my classpath).
>>
>> I appreciate all your helps.
>> Thanks,
>> Nancy
>>
>> ----- Original Message -----
>> From: "Tambascio, Larry" <ltambascio@...>
>> To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
>> Sent: Friday, February 28, 2003 3:35 PM
>> Subject: RE: [junit] incompatible types
>>
>>
>> > Hi,
>> >
>> > You named your class "Test". This conflicts with
>> junit.framework.Test.
>> Try
>> > naming your class something like TestNancy, and see if that helps.
>> >
>> > Good luck,
>> > -Larry
>> >
>> > -----Original Message-----
>> > From: Nancy [mailto:logmail2003@...]
>> > Sent: Friday, February 28, 2003 3:22 PM
>> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>> > Subject: [junit] incompatible types
>> >
>> >
>> > hi
>> >
>> > I have the following code:
>> >
>> > =======================================
>> >
>> > import junit.framework.*;
>> > import java.util.*;
>> >
>> > public class Test extends TestCase {
>> > ArrayList a;
>> > public Test(String name) {
>> > super(name);
>> > }
>> > protected void setUp() {
>> > a = new ArrayList();
>> > }
>> >
>> > public void test() {
>> > assertTrue(a.size() == 8);
>> > }
>> >
>> > public static Test suite() {
>> > return new TestSuite(Test.class); //This line shows
>> incompatible
>> > types error
>> > }
>> >
>> > public static void main(String[] args) {
>> > junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
>> > }
>> > }
>> > ====================================================
>> >
>> > When the above code was compiled, I got the error saying: "
>> incompatible
>> > types found: junit.framework.TestSuite required : Test, return new
>> > TestSuite(Test.class)".
>> >
>> > My understanding is: Test extends TestSuite. I am not sure why it
>> complains
>> > at following line -----
>> >
>> > return new TestSuite(Test.class);
>> >
>> > I appreciate your help.
>> > Thanks,
>> > Nancy
>> >
>> >
>> > [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
